blog.name: alle23212
blog.title: Alle.
blog.description:
librisognierealta.it è il mio blog.
Ho sempre sentito il bisogno di averne uno, ma non avevo mai trovato un argomento che mi spingesse a continuare a scrivere, finché non ho abbracciato la mia natura ossessia-compulsiva e assolutamente pignola! Da questo è nato il mio blog di recensioni e scleri di vario genere: Libri, Sogni e Realtà.

summary: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones 5 - Hizdhar Zo Loraq
title: Dal libro alla serie: Game of Thrones 5 - Hizdhar Zo Loraq
body:
Nella quinta stagione di Game of Thrones, moltissimi personaggi sono stati semplificati, mentre la loro storia nel libro è più complessa. Uno di questi è proprio Hizdhar Zo Loraq. Cliccate sul link se siete curiosi di scoprire di cosa sto parlando :D

Dal libro alla serie:
Game of Thrones 5 – Hizdhar Zo Loraq

Stiamo ancora parlando della quinta stagione di Game of Thrones, per parlare di Daenerys e di Hizdhar Zo Loraq, dobbiamo andare a prendere i capitoli del quinto libro.

Per ora è l’ultimo romanzo su cui possiamo mettere le mani. È uscito nel 2011, sette anni fa, ed è stato chiamato La danza dei draghi e comprende tre libri: I guerrieri…

View On WordPress

title: [SPOILERS] I'm really looking forward to...
body:
… the Maesters finding out about the Night King’s invasion of the Seven Kingdoms. For so long, the Maesters have flat out denied the possibility of the Army of the Dead even existing, and now they will learn that not only are the White Walkers and wights very real, they have breached the Wall and are marching south, toward the Seven Kingdoms, toward Oldtown.



Source: https://ift.tt/2IsvMFs

summary:
- IMAGINE: Telling Jon that you are pregnant with his child.
Jon sits in a chamber together with Sam, doing some paper work and...
body:
- IMAGINE: Telling Jon that you are pregnant with his child.

Jon sits in a chamber together with Sam, doing some paper work and preparing the war against the white walkers. You thought Jon would be alone here and so you look surprised at Sam. “Oh, excuse me. I thought I would meet only you, I will come back later.” Sam stands up from his chair and stretches his back. “No, it alright. I need a pause anyway and Jon too. I will go to the maester to send some ravens.”

“Thank you Sam.”, you smile at him and head towards Jon, after the door is shut. He looks tired and you just want to take him to bed with you. “Is anything wrong?” he asks and look curiously in your eyes, Jon way to look at you always melts your heard. “No, nothing is wrong. Well, not really. I don’t know how to tell you this, but I have to, someday you will find it out anyway-“

“Y/n, just say it how it is. You don’t have to be afraid or something like that.” You take a deep breath and try to find the right words. “Alright. I’m pregnant with our child, I know this ain’t the right time to have a child..” Jon pulls you into his arms and holds you tight, while you close you eyes. He doesn’t talk but the way he holds you is all you need right now. “He will hopefully grow up in a better world.”

“Or she.”

“Oh…”

summary:
You ever just think about how people make a man into a saviour (hE’s SaViNG tHe WoRLd)

 for emotionally and sexually...
body:
You ever just think about how people make a man into a saviour (hE’s SaViNG tHe WoRLd) for emotionally and sexually manipulating a woman who is giving what said man wants without real cause to assume she’ll back out, (meanwhile saving his life), and then rewarding the man and villainizing the woman to justify it all.

Like YIKES, I’m glad that’s not MY fandom.

summary:
Me: Sorry, boss. Can't work today. 
Boss: Why?
Me: There might be coming a trailer for GoT 8 today, so naturally I have to check...
body:
Me: Sorry, boss. Can’t work today.

Boss: Why?

Me: There might be coming a trailer for GoT 8 today, so naturally I have to check the internet constantly, completely ignoring the time difference.

Boss: …

Boss: You’re fired.

Me: *narrows eyes*

Me: *hisses* Valar Morghulis!

Boss: Gesundheit. Now leave.

summary: Do you think there's still a chance dany doesn't go dark and dies saving the world with jon and tyrion like the fandom has...
question: Do you think there's still a chance dany doesn't go dark and dies saving the world with jon and tyrion like the fandom has always thought?
answer:
Of course there is but I think evidence in the show suggests that’s not going to be the case. I think Dany was increasingly shown to be the protagonist rather than a hero in Essos especially in Meereen when she’s shown to be failing as a ruler as well failing morally. Season 7 showed her losing and more importantly her rage and need to destroy her enemies regardless of the collateral damage. In fact the show presented the slow starvation of King’s Landing as better than flying her dragons to the Red Keep, interestingly without mentioning the wildfire stored under the city. D&D went out of their way to humanise Lannister soldiers in the presence of two popular characters- Arya and Jaime and in fact went the extra mile by having them be kind to Arya who hasn’t been treated well by others in years with the exception of Lady Crane. Arya’s decision to let them leave happens before she decides to abandon the quest to kill Cersei and go home. We literally see the Loot Train Battle from Jaime’s POV and the horror of people burning to death was highlighted. Compare this to the Battle in Meereen in which she burns the Yunkai soldiers but the camera doesn’t linger on their corpses and the Yunkai masters aren’t presented as likeable or horrified. So they have changed the usual way of presenting Dany. In all her previous battles, we see Dany gaining something whether it’s the Unsullied or Meereen but all we see her do is kill soldiers, destroy wagons and forced a few hundred soldiers to kneel to her. It feels less like a victory and more like a slaughter.

There’s also Dany’s reluctance to fight the Night King. If she was the hero her fans present her as, then the moment she sees the Night King, she should have committed and yet a major issue the next episode is the truce. Dany needs reassurance that Cersei won’t seize more territories. At this point Jon has willingly left the North, became a prisoner and even knelt just to get dragonglass and Dany’s dragons. I don’t know about you but Dany falls short by a lot in comparison. If the next season was going to be everything Jonerys stans expect, then Dany should have thrown herself at the fight against the Night King so that afterwards she and her nephew can fight a righteous war against Cersei and take back everything Cersei seized. Instead we have a strong feeling that was voiced by Jaime that if Dany finds out she was tricked, she would destroy Cersei. Coupled with the fact that Dany didn’t leave for the North until Cersei gave her word and her insistence that the dragons are her only children after one of them was easily killed, I really don’t see Dany staying in the North for long and I don’t see her sacrificing herself or her children for the greater good.

summary:

summary: Why is everybody suddenly talking about sansa taking off her clothes suddenly? Is that from trailer?
question: Why is everybody suddenly talking about sansa taking off her clothes suddenly? Is that from trailer?
answer: I have no idea but if I had to guess it’s about Sophie’s interview in which she mentioned Sansa is going to wear an armor and some people freaked out that instead of Sansa letting go of her fears, she seems to be guarding herself more. Like I said in the other ask, the armor has a function because there’s a war unlike her season 7 dress which did show her need to protect herself from other people. They don’t have a similar function.
